content.question: Solvent Boiling Point <math alttext="degrees Celsius" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext></mtext><mi>Â°</mi><mtext>C</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> Relative Polarity Pentane 36 <math alttext="0.1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> Hexane 68 <math alttext="0.1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> Ethyl acetate 77 <math alttext="4.4" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4.4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> Methanol 65 <math alttext="5.1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>5.1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> The diagram above shows a thin-layer chromatogram of a mixture of polar products from a chemical reaction. The separation was performed using <math alttext="50 percent" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>50</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> ethyl acetate in hexane as the solvent (mobile phase) and silica gel as the polar stationary phase. On the basis of the chromatogram and the information about solvents in the table above, which of the following would be the best way to decrease the distance that the polar products travel up the plate?

choices.label: Use pentane instead of hexane in the solvent.
Decrease the percentage of ethyl acetate in the solvent.
Increase the percentage of ethyl acetate in the solvent.
Add up to <math alttext="5 percent" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>5</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> methanol to the solvent.

content.answer: Decrease the percentage of ethyl acetate in the solvent.

skill.text: 2.C: Identify experimental procedures that are aligned to a scientific question (which may include a sketch of a lab setup).
